attributes.action: Set a State of National Emergency for Flood Victims
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I believe that Gordon Brown should have done weeks ago and set a State of National Emergency, that the High Street Banks could have worked towards helping our communities, initially by setting up an appeals fund to assist these poor people in clearing up their flood damaged properties.  This needs to be done sooner rather than later.

For those of us that live on a hill or away from the flood areas, we should be grateful for that and count our blessings, but as a nation we need too support our own.  "Charity starts at Home"

We did this for the Tsunami victims why not our own people?

We cannot wait for the authorities to act on this we need to help them now!

Banks need to act straight away so that the nation can put its hand in its pockets.

TV appeals should have been set up to aid these people not just as a reporting tool
